name: market for wheat bran | wheat bran | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20696/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'wheat bran', in the geography of South Africa. This is a constrained market for consequential system model, for attributional system models, this is a regular market. In the case of consequential system model, details about the marginal consumer can be found in the comment of the conditional exchange (by-product).;This dataset represents the transport of 1 kg of wheat bran from the whole wheat processing facility (mill) to the associated market, i.e. beef cattle feedlots. No losses are considered in this dataset.;This is a constrained market. The justification for a market constraint is included in the comment field of the conditional exchange. ;The product 'wheat bran' is a by-product of the wheat grain processing (dry milling). It is used for animal feed.

The activity starts at the mill gate.

The activity ends with the provision of wheat bran at the feedlot gate.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/106:Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products/1061:Manufacture of grain mill products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: South African values: Not applicable worldwide.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data are intended to reflect current equipment and processes in South Africa.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data is primarily sourced from literature and statistics.

exchanges.description: Estimated value based on the breakdown of whole processed (i.e. dry milling of wheat) (SAGIS, 2017) and feedlot by province (du Toit et al, 2013). It was assumed that feedlots would source wheat bran from within the region first, which amounted to 97% of wheat bran. It was further assumed that wheat bran is transported an average distance of 100km within the province. For the remaining 3% of wheat bran to be tranported to feedlots in Gauteng (GP), Limpopo (LM), North West (NW) and Free State (FS) Provinces a weighted average distance was applied based on a breakdown of the surplus wheat bran available in the other provinces and the distance from these regions to the corresponding feedlots. The distances were estimated using Google Maps. Reference(s): SAGIS (2017) Processing per Province - May 2015 to April 2016, South African Grain Information System. Available at: http://www.sagis.org.za/processing-per-province.html (Accessed April 2017); Du Toit, C.J.L., Meissner, H.H. & van Niekerk, W.A. (2013) Direct methane and nitrous oxide emissions of South African dairy and beef cattle, South African Journal of Animal Science (43) 320-339.
